hanzi-su-wiki:
賊

Значения

Повстанец; бандит, грабитель

Мнемоника

Справа — копьё 戈 и нож. Бандит отнимает деньги 貝 оружием.

Варианты

贼, 戝
purpleculture_pinyin:
zéi
thief; traitor; wily; deceitful; evil; extremely
вор; предатель; хитрый; лживый; зло; очень сильно
rtega_mnemonic:
賊賊RS
贼贼		thief, traitor, rebel, harm, kill
  • person using a weapon 戈 to steal 10 十 times more money 貝

(Simplified: 贼)
Pictophonetic: 貝 indicates the sound; 戎 (weapons) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
賊亮 [ zéi liàng ]: bright; shiny; dazzling; glaring
賊心 [ zéi xīn ]: evil intentions
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 戎 [ róng ] arms, armaments; military affairs
heisig_chinese_memo: Burglars... those guys!!! Burglars only want money (clams) so that they can get needles (drugs) and party (fiesta)!
heisig_constituent: burglar, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, ten, needle, fiesta
heisig_story: From a burglar's point of view, a fiesta is an occasion to takeout the old lock picking needle and break into the unattended safe filled with the family shells (the old form of money, as we saw in frames 84 and 206).
koohiiStory1: Burglars... those guys!!! Burglars only want money (clams) so that they can get needles (drugs) and party (fiesta)!
koohiiStory2: After the fiesta, we found out that some burglar had stolen our money, probably breaking in with a lockpick needle...
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When a shellfish becomes a drunkard and sees a cross, they'll become a robber. Because they'll steal the cross!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Some people make really bad choices when they're drunk, and in this case, when a shellfish gets drunk and sees something it wants it'll just rob people for it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Once the shellfish has a taste for being a robber, he'll join a Bosozoku (ぞく) bike gang so he can keep stealing more and more crosses. He'll drink more, steal more, and get to ride cool motorcycles.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture a robber shellfish in a Bosozoku bike gang. Look at him the wrong way and he and his gang will steal all your stuff next time!
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 十 (десять), 戈 (копьё), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese:
zéi: (графема) злодей, предатель; злой, дурной
zéi: (сущ/прил/нареч) вор; хитрый, лукавый; (диал.) очень, крайне
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) uses ten spears (戎) against the burglar
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Burglars just want shells to buy needles/drugs and go to fiestas.
humanum_full_description_en:
"Book. "Shun Dian": "Thieves are rape." Kong Anguo's "Biography": "Killing is a thief." "Shu Wen": "Thieves, you are defeated. From Ge, the sound."

Bronze inscriptions mean harm and harm, and the Sanshi disc: "If you have Sanshi heart thief, you will be fined a thousand whips." "Heart Thief" means "Thief Heart", which means that there is a heart of harm. "Historical Records. "Uncle Wei Kang Family": "Wu Geng has not been collected, I am afraid that he will be guilty."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " the " from " Ge ", " it " is the sound character. From " Ge " has the meaning of harm.
humanum_full_description:
《書．舜典》：「𡨥賊姦宄。」孔安國《傳》：「殺人曰賊。」《說文》：「賊，敗也。从戈則聲。」

　　金文表示傷害、加害，散氏盤：「余有散氏心賊，則鞭千罰千」。「心賊」即「賊心」，表示有加害之心。《史記．衛康叔世家》：「為武庚未集，恐其有賊心。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「則」從「戈」，「則」是聲符。從「戈」有傷害之意。

贼贼 		thief, traitor, rebel, harm, kill
  • person using a weapon 戈 to steal 10 十 times more money 貝
(Simplified: 贼)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 貝 indicates the sound; 戎 (weapons) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 戎 [ róng ] arms, armaments; military affairs
①偷東西的人，盜匪：賊人。盜賊。賊贓。賊窩。
②對人民有危害的人：國賊。民賊。工賊。賊寇。蟊賊。
③害，傷害：戕賊。“淫侈之俗日日以長，是天下之大賊也”。
④邪的，不正派的：賊心不死。
⑤狡猾：賊溜溜。
⑥副詞，很：賊冷。賊亮。賊橫(héng)。
賊亮 [ zéi liàng ]: bright; shiny; dazzling; glaring
賊心 [ zéi xīn ]: evil intentions

Bronze inscriptions mean harm and harm, and the Sanshi disc: "If you have Sanshi heart thief, you will be fined a thousand whips." "Heart Thief" means "Thief Heart", which means that there is a heart of harm. "Historical Records. "Uncle Wei Kang Family": "Wu Geng has not been collected, I am afraid that he will be guilty."

賊字的基本解释

賊
zéi
见“贼”。

賊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zéi］
［《廣韻》昨則切，入德，從。］
亦作“戝1”。“贼1”的繁体字。
(1)败坏；毁坏。
(2)谗毁。
(3)害；伤害。
(4)杀戮；杀害。亦指杀人者。
(5)祸害。
(6)谓对国家、人民、社会道德风尚造成严重危害的人。
(7)抢劫或偷窃财物的人。
(8)偷窃。
(9)诈伪；狡黠。
(10)邪辟不正。参见“賊心”、“賊相”。
(11)詈词。
(12)暴虐，狠毒。
(13)克，制约。
(14)方言。很，十分。表示程度相当高。多用于贬义。
(15)一种专食苗节的害虫。

賊字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賊； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1208第14
【廣韻】昨則切【集韻】【韻會】疾則切，?音蠈。盜也。【玉篇】刧人也。【書·舜典】?賊姦宄。【傳】殺人曰賊。　又【詩·大雅】不僭不賊。【傳】不殘賊。又【左傳·僖九年】不僭不賊。【註】賊，傷害也。　又【周禮·夏官·大司馬】賊賢害民，則伐之。【疏】賊虐。　又害苗之蟲。【詩·小雅】去其螟螣，及其蟊賊。【傳】食節曰賊。【陸璣疏】賊似桃李中蠹蟲，赤頭身長而細耳。

賊字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

賊字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
thief
zéi
See "thief".
thief
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zéi］
["Guangyun" cut yesterday, enter Germany, follow. ]
Also known as "戝1". "Thief 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Corruption; destruction.
(2) Slander.
(3) Harm; harm.
(4) Killing; killing. Also refers to the murderer.
(5) Harm.
(6) Those who have caused serious harm to the country, people, and social morals.
(7) People who rob or steal property.
(8) Stealing.
(9) Fraud; cunning.
(10) Evil is not right. See "Thief Heart", "Thief Phase".
(11) Literary words.
(12) Tyrannical and vicious.
(13) Gram, restriction.
(14) Dialects. Very, very much. The degree of expression is quite high. Mostly used in derogatory sense.
(15) A pest that specializes in seedling festival.
thief
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　thief; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1208 Page 14
[Guang Yun] Cut yesterday [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Cut it if you are sick,? Yin Lei. Pirate also. [Jade articles] Robbery. 【Book·Shun Code】? Thieves are treacherous. [Biography] Killing is called a thief.　[Poetry·Daya] No arrogant or thief. [Biography] Do not break thieves. Also [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Nian Nian] No arrogance, no thief. [Note] Thieves, hurt too.　[Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Da Sima】Thieves and virtuous people harm the people, then cut them down. 【Sparse】Thief abuse.　Insects against seedlings again. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Go to the scorpion and its thief. [Biography] The food festival is called a thief. 【Lu Jishu】The thief resembles a peach and plum midge, with a red head and a long body and thin ears.

Name meaning

zéi
вм. 贼
Radicals: 貝, 戈, 十  (shellfish, drunkard, cross)
Meaning Mnemonic
When a shellfish becomes a drunkard and sees a cross, they'll become a robber. Because they'll steal the cross!
Some people make really bad choices when they're drunk, and in this case, when a shellfish gets drunk and sees something it wants it'll just rob people for it.
Reading Mnemonic
Once the shellfish has a taste for being a robber, he'll join a Bosozoku (ぞく) bike gang so he can keep stealing more and more crosses. He'll drink more, steal more, and get to ride cool motorcycles.
Picture a robber shellfish in a Bosozoku bike gang. Look at him the wrong way and he and his gang will steal all your stuff next time!
